definition: to whine about hardships/to complain of one's bitter lot/to complain/to grumble
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly/incessant grievances
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
to feign and complain bitterly of being poverty stricken (idiom)

sentences.english: Again has a look us, usually meets slightly is difficult, we all complain incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 再看看我們，平時遇到一點小困難，我們都叫苦連天。

sentences.english: Then students started to complain incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 那名學生又開始叫苦不迭。

sentences.english: The road works caused much complaint among local neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使當地居民叫苦連天。

sentences.english: The chancellor of the Exchequer groaned about our dwindling dollar resources.
sentences.chinese: 財政大臣爲我們日益減少的美元儲備而叫苦。

sentences.english: This is a journey that's filled with complaints.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場人們叫苦不迭的旅途。

sentences.english: The road-works caused much complaint among local neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使當地居民叫苦連天。

sentences.english: Weed out the uncommitted whiners and complainers early.
sentences.chinese: 儘早剔除那些抱怨叫苦者。

sentences.english: Nonetheless, if it moves toward reality, Wall Street will howl.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一旦它被變成現實，華爾街就得叫苦了。

sentences.english: Come and go, but as soon as the tsunami hit and then complain incessantly when.
sentences.chinese: 此起彼伏，而一旦如海嘯般襲來的時候再叫苦不迭。

definition: to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly/incessant grievances
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain
